results.title: Puberty Blues
results.creator_credit: Limelight Productions, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Bruce Beresford
results.brief_description: A popular coming-of-age story set on Cronulla Beach, where two high school girls, Debbie and Sue, have to navigate the chauvinism and sexism of the popular Greenhills surf gang to find their own selves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Limelight Productions, Joan Long, Margaret Kelly and Bruce Beresford
results.description: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. Debbie and Sue are accepted into the Greenhills’ gang, an elite group occupying a particular stretch of Cronulla beach. As surfie groupies Debbie and Sue are required to submit to male whims. Although the girls are proposed as subjects the film maintains a humorously ironic distance from the awfulness of the scene, particularly through the use of narration. The boys, collectively dominant, are individually consigned to the margins. Debbie and Sue are the real mates who ultimately break out of the confines of male-imposed rules. Cast includes: Nell Schofield, Jad Capelja, Geoff Rhoe, Tony Hughes. Based on the book by Cathy Lette and Gabrielle Carey.
description_for_label: Unusually, the focus here is on the sexual and social rites of passage of two teenage girls in a male-dominated world. results.title: PT 109
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Bryan Foy and Leslie H Martinson
results.brief_description: During the second world war, president to be John Fitzgerald Kennedy took part in the war effort by skippering a PT (Plywood Torpedo) boat in the Solomon Islands. Cliff Robertson enacts these exploits in ‘PT 109’, with a plot that centres around the assignment of harassing the enemy to buy time for a U.S Navy still in development, and a daring rescue by Kennedy to save an injured soldier. Kennedy’s boat - PT 109 , was sliced in half by a Japanese destroyer in August 1943. Lieutenant Kennedy was in the region on a rescue mission to retrieve Marines stranded upon the Isle of Choiseul. It became imperative for him to devise a plan to get his men, and the rescued marines to safety by navigating a safe path through a potentially enemy dominated area. Strangely enough, the successful plan involved a coconut. Cast also includes Ty Hardin, James Gregory, Robert Culp and Grant Williams.

results.title: Psycho (1998) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Image Entertainment, Brian Grazer and Gus Van Sant
results.brief_description: Gus Van Sant’s faithful scene by scene colour ‘recreation’ (the term preferred by the director over ‘remake’) of Hitchcock’s classic thriller about the fate of Marion Crane (Anne Heche in the role made famous by Janet Leigh) who, on-the-run with a large amount of stolen cash, stops at an isolated motel run by Norman Bates (Vince Vaughn) , where she meets an untimely end. Cast also includes Julianne Moore as Marion’s sister and William H. Macy as the private investigator she hires to find her sister.

results.title: Psycho (1960) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Shamley Productions, Paramount Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herrmann’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.

results.title: Proof (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: House and Moorhouse Films, Lynda House and Jocelyn Moorhouse
results.brief_description: Winner of 7 Australian Film Institute awards, “Proof” is a provocative and engrossing film about a man’s obsessive search for truth. Martin (Hugo Weaving) has been blind from birth. He trusts no-one, except for the camera which has replaced his eyes. His photos are proof that the world he senses is the same as other people see. Then he meets a young kitchen hand, Andy, whose honesty and kindness allow Martin to trust for the first time - until Martin’s jealous housekeeper, Celia, sets out to destroy this relationship. Written and directed by Jocelyn Moorhouse who won a 1992 Victorian Premier’s Literary Award for her screenplay.

results.title: Project X
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Walter Parkes, Lawrence Lasker and Jonathan Kaplan
results.brief_description: Pilot Jimmy Garrett (Mathew Broderick) finds himself working on a special military assignment as punishment when he is grounded for misconduct. His mission is to teach chimpanzees to fly through the use of flight simulators, and he quickly discovers an affinity with the animals who he begins communicating with. When he befriends researcher Teri (Helen Hunt) and her number one student, a chimpanzee called Virgil she has successfully taught sign language to, Garrett discovers something that wasn’t in the brief - the real purpose of “Project X” is to test the limits of human endurance by subjecting the experimental primates to radiation. Teri and Jimmy are forced to question their loyalties to science, their careers, and the animals that have become friends. Cast also includes Bill Sadler, Johnny Ray McGhee and Jonathan Stark.

results.title: Project grizzly
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Allder and Peter Lynch
results.brief_description: Troy Hurtubise on 18th May 2002, once again made the news with a demonstration of his latest grizzly bear suit ‘Ursus Mark VII’. ‘Project grizzly’ documents his story. Troy Hurtubise’s obsession was given birth to over 10 years ago when he was confronted by a grizzly bear whilst trekking alone in the Canadian wilderness. Under an extraordinary set of circumstances the grizzly spares Troy’s life and so an obsession is born. The task Troy set himself is to build a suit that will withstand an attack from a grizzly bear. The mission is to again confront ‘Old Man’ (Troy’s name for the grizzly) whilst wearing the suit to continue his “close quarter bear research”. After $150,000 has been spent and 6 proto-types later Troy takes us through the joys and tribulations of his experimentation whilst admitting that he suffers from claustrophobia. By the end of the documentary we see Troy in suit being bashed with base-ball bats, lead balls and hit by a 3-tonne truck travelling at 50km/h - 18 times! So will Troy get his sniff of ‘Old Man’ or will the transport of the suit impede the project? Also shown is a reconstructed Ska-Nah-Doht, a traditional Iroquoian village.

results.title: Prizzi's honor
results.creator_credit: ABC Motion Pictures, John Foreman and John Huston
results.brief_description: Jack Nicholson stars as Charley Partanna an aging hit-man for a powerful Mafia family, the Prizzis. He meets and falls in love with Irene Walker (Kathleen Turner) the widow of his latest victim, masquerading as a tax consultant. When he discovers that Irene is a hired killer and has cheated his own Mafia family, his loyalties are painfully divided. To complicate matters, Maerose Prizzi, (Anjelica Huston in an Academy Award winning performance for Best Supporting Actress), the black sheep of the powerful clan, harbors a lost love for Charley and manoeuvers the plot of this tragic-comedy in insidious ways. Based on the novel by Richard Condon.

results.title: Privates on parade
results.creator_credit: Hand Made Films, Simon Relph and Michael Blakemore
results.brief_description: To fight the good fight, British soldiers in Southeast Asia will need to laugh the good laugh. That’s where Major Giles Flack (John Cleese) and his morale-boosting theatrical troup led by the gloriously high-camp Acting Captain Terri Dennis (Denis Quilley) come in. The war and the show must go on! A farcical musical comedy underscored by the realities of war. Screenplay and lyrics by Peter Nichols based on his own play “Privates on parade”, music composed and conducted by Denis King. Cast also includes Nicola Pagett, Patrick Pearson, Joe Melia, Simon Jones, Michael Elphick, John Standing. Executive producer - George Harrison (Beatles). Contains b&w scenes.
